messages.subject: Re: Children's list
messages.msgSnippet: Jessi, My daughter would like to join your unschooledfriends list and just wanted to make sure the automatic request-for-approval message from Yahoo Groups
messages.messageBody:
Jessi,

My daughter would like to join your unschooledfriends list and just wanted
to make sure the automatic request-for-approval message from Yahoo Groups
didn't get lost. She keeps asking every day when she can start reading and
posting!

Joyce




on 10/11/01 8:14 AM, Jessi at mistycal@... wrote:

> The group I had started for the children is going great! The kids have
> been wonderful and we even have a few of them that post almost every
> day. It has been great to see them and for them to talk. Granted, it is
> kid talk which could be one or two sentences but it is fun :o)
>
> There are about 18 children on here and we are always welcome to more
> joining us! To do so, just write to
> unschooledfriends-subscribe@yahoogroups.com and I will write back to you
> to make sure they have permission to join the group. Once I get this, they
> are allowed on and can chat away!
>
> Jessi

messages.subject: Children's list
messages.msgSnippet: The group I had started for the children is going great!  The kids have been wonderful and we even have a few of them that post almost every day.  It has been
messages.messageBody:
The group I had started for the children is going great! The kids have
been wonderful and we even have a few of them that post almost every
day. It has been great to see them and for them to talk. Granted, it is
kid talk which could be one or two sentences but it is fun :o)

There are about 18 children on here and we are always welcome to more
joining us! To do so, just write to
unschooledfriends-subscribe@yahoogroups.com and I will write back to you
to make sure they have permission to join the group. Once I get this, they
are allowed on and can chat away!

Jessi






<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**
Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
~ Roger Lewin ~
<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**
